comment.author: 23224989@N07
comment._content: This is obviously some kind of roadside wrestling match... to let the kids get out and stretch their legs.  As far as a roomy outhouse, I suspect the larger is storage while the smaller is a "one-holer" (notice the privacy fence).  Grand-dad always said, "When you get to Underwear in the Monkey Ward catalog, it's time for a new catalog."  Also, concerning corn cobs, "Red's for doin' the job.  White's for makin' sure you got the job done!".

comment.author: 23302438@N03
comment._content: Possibly a schoolhouse, rather than a church?

comment.author: 95517600@N00
comment._content:
Clearly a school house.  If this is Kansas, it would be eastern or south-eastern.  The limestone foundation does suggest midwest.

The school does not seem to be open, but the boys are roughhousing about.  No cars, bikes, horses, or dogs, which seems strange.

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thanks to all for the keen observations. We’ll look into this description further. (Any changes won't appear right away because we need to keep the information we show here in Flickr and in our own catalog ( http://www.loc.gov/rr/print/catalog.html) in sync.)

comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: There's a pickup truck parked on the far side of the building.

comment._content: i think they are waiting for a ride
